amendment.description: Amendment prohibits any funds in the bill from being used to develop, plan, implement, or administer any national testing program in reading or mathematics.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 5 in the Congressional Record of July 28, 1997, to prohibit any funds appropriate in the bill from being used to develop, plan, implement, or administer any national testing program in reading or mathematics. The amendment would exempt activities carried out under the National Assessment of Educational Progress and the Third International Math and Science Study.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Goodling amendment (A035) Agreed to by recorded vote: 295 - 125 (Roll no. 398).
